greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction for sqrt(29).
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
Index entries for continued fractions for constants
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0, 0, 0, 0, 1).
formula: a(0) = 5; a(n) = 8 - 8*ceiling(n/5) + 8*floor(n/5) + ceiling((n-2)/5) - floor((n-2)/5) + ceiling((n-3)/5) - floor((n-3)/5). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Apr 01 2014
program: (PARI) { allocatemem(932245000); default(realprecision, 18000); x=contfrac(sqrt(29)); for (n=0, 20000, write("b010128.txt", n, " ", x[n+1])); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 04 2009
xref: Cf. A010484 (Decimal expansion). - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 04 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
